g.text: Rendering
Collisions
"Vanilla model" modded only by Forge or Liteloader or Partial Modification Loader
An Utility mod do a backup of the "vanilla model" to a new "dummy model".
For example let's name it "The Drill Utilities"
> This mod will always be loaded after :
>> Forge
>> LiteLoader
>> Partial Modification Loader
>> Or equivalent
> This mod will always be loaded before the things that are coming next
Let's create a "Customisable Model Manager"
Let's create a dummy model (everything null inside) trough the previous "Cusomisable Model manager"
Let's create a copy of the Vanilla model (that was previously backup)
A mod like No Cubes will only edit the vertices and peaks of this model trough the CTM mod.
All those customisation will be stored into a new "dummy model" from "The Drill".
Examples for the following magical things that will happen.
For this example we will take the models of those like grass or the ones of the fluids.
By fluids I mean air, water, lava, or equivalent from other mods.
Now we take two mods :
> The Seasons Mod by The_WeatherPony
> The No Cubes mod by a lot of guys.
A mod like The Seasons mod will firstly only edit the light / color / opcity of the model.
All those customisation will be stored into a new "dummy model" from "The Drill".
Let's create a copy of the Vanilla model (that was previously backup)
Now let's create a new "dummy" model (trough The Drill) that will be a combination of those previous "dummy" models (see the lines and them arrows).
Now we MUST edit the light / level according to the position of light sources.
All of that into a new "dummy model"
Now we say that the final model is quite finished.
Now take the vertices and peaks and of the final model and use them for the doing the collisions.
(Like it was done by a mod like No Cubes in 1.7.10)
Examples for the following magical things that will happen.
Only for a model that will not be customised by mods like those :
> The Seasons Mod by The_Weather_Pony
> The No Cubes mod by a lot of guys.
So models like those from the furnace.
The VANILLA MODEL is succesfully kept like it was without any more customisation.
Without the use of CTM.
Examples for the following magical things that will happen.
For a model from a MOD like those :
> Carpenter's Blocks
> Architecture Craft
> BiblioCraft
Take the code from 1.6.4 / 1.7.10 of this mod if it wasnt updated to more recent version of the game.
Easily convert the Java code from 1.6.4 / 1.7.10 to code that will work with a "Custom Model" fromt "The drill".
Without the use of CTM.
CTM will be USED here to help the customisation of those next models.
Only to get the XYZ pos if it's still necessary.
A part of the cache created by all of those "dummy models" will be kept for other mods.
"dummy models" mean models that are instance of a "Customisable model" writen partially trough "The drill".
CTM will not be necessary if we know how to replace all the dynamic code (if statements, for loops)
by something more static and that we will equilibrate the usage CPU and the usage of the GPU,
depending on the power of the CPU or GPU (Nvidia GPU is more powerfull than Intel GPU for example).
